noun.description: A means of approaching or entering a place.
examples: the staircase gives access to the top floor
the bypass will greatly improve road access
the building has a side access

noun.description: An attack or outburst of an emotion.
examples: I was suddenly overcome with an access of rage
single rooms have private baths accessed via the balcony

verb.description: Obtain, examine, or retrieve (data or a file).

origin: Middle English (in the sense sudden attack of illness): from Latin accessus, from the verb accedere to approach (see accede). access (sense 1 of the noun) is first recorded in the early 17th century.
